alert.note: Alert for Delaware; Franklin; Licking (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 23 at 6:00AM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHEASTERN FRANKLIN, SOUTHERN DELAWARE AND CENTRAL LICKING COUNTIES THROUGH 630 AM EDT... At 559 AM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located over Powell, moving east at 65 mph. HAZARD...Winds gusts up to 35 mph, half inch hail, and frequent cloud-to-ground lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Lightning can cause serious injury or death. Locations impacted include... Columbus, Newark, Dublin, Westerville, Delaware, Worthington, Heath, Granville, Pataskala, Powell, Johnstown, Sunbury, Utica, Minerva Park, Granville South, Polaris, New Albany, Jersey, Shawnee Hills and Galena. This includes I-71 in Ohio between mile markers 116 and 130. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...35 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. When thunder roars, go indoors! Do not stay in the open or seek shelter under trees when lightning threatens. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
